SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Create Metadata for the Namespace List Configuration Added in a Patch

Some patches for B2B Commerce for Visualforce add a reference to a new storefront configuration setting that uses the API name ui.nsList. If you're upgrading to one of these patches, manually create the appropriate metadata before you can set the configuration setting on your storefront.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

Any org updating to or installing:

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) patch 3.149.9 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) patch 3.147.14 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) patch 3.145.30 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) patch 3.142.37 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.48 or later
CloudCraze version 4.8 patch 3.133.32 or later
CloudCraze version 4.7 patch 3.124.46 or later


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
Install the patch build in your org.
Create metadata for the ui.nsList configuration.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Configuration Modules (1) from the Global Settings menu.
From the Configuration Modules list, select User Interface.
Click New (3), enter the following details in the Configuration Metadata window, and click Save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Static Resource Namespaces List
API Name	nsList (required)
Description	A comma-separated list of the namespaces used in the static resources that you want to query for your storefront. Avoid spaces between comma values, and be sure to include the default ccrz namespace in the list.
Externally Safe	FALSE (leave unselected)
NOTE The API name and Externally Safe values shown are required, but the Name and Description are up to you.
Set a value on your storefront for the configuration setting that you created.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront.
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings.
From the Module picklist, select User Interface.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	User Interface
Configuration	Static Resource Namespaces List
Page	all
Value	Enter ccrz,other-namespace where other-namespace is a custom namespace that you want to include.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO
Manage Configuration Settings
